titleStmt.title: K. William or K. Lewis wherein is set forth the inevitable necessity these nations lye under : of submitting wholly to one or other of these kings, and that the matter in controversie is not now between K. William and K. James, but between K. William and K. Lewis of France, for the government of these nations / written out of Cheshire by a gentleman lately arriv'd there from Ireland.
titleStmt.author: Gentleman lately arriv'd there from Ireland.

titleStmt.title: K. William or K. William and K. James, but between K. William and K. Lewis of France, for the government of these nations / written out of Cheshire by a gentleman lately arriv'd there from Ireland.
titleStmt.author: Gentleman lately arriv'd there from Ireland.

notesStmt.note: Running title: King William, or King Lewis.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
Bound with C1A, J1264, J1200A, D827B, and V535.

person.persName: Gentleman lately arriv'd there from Ireland.
